text: Are you kidding me ? Shannyn Moore admits she doesn't watch Fox news , or any TV news for that matter--then proceeds to lecture us how bad Fox is . Where does she get her information from to knock Fox ? She proves herself to be clueless.  She's not alone. Every liberal tells everyone how terrible and slanted Fox is , yet when you ask how often they watch that channel and they boast they never do.  So how do they know ?  Without getting into Shannyn's pathetic disrespect of our president--she clearly hasn't a clue about the national media and how they are anti-Trump 24 / 7 . A recent study showed 92 percent of all national stories are anti-Trump. In the past the Dispatch ran anti-Trump front page stories 7 days a week. There is littler wonder why he considers the press dishonest--because they are. If Trump found the cure for cancer they'd blame him for doing it to save his own life. Meaningless poll numbers are low because he's knocked 24 / 7 . Moore hates Trump, Fox and conservatives.

I've been sort of paying attention to this issue for a while, and being a dedicated jerk, my natural tendency is to think that maybe the students are just stupid ... but what about depression and lethargy, due to lack of sunlight during the winter months? Maybe your kids aren't stupid, but simply need sunlight, some vitamin-C?
Maybe Florida does better because there is a lot more sunlight there? Alaska seems to have the most depression related events, and general feelings of not wanting to do anything during winter. Well, could poor grades be a depression and lethargy related thing?
It would be an easy theory to test. Choose one school, install UV lighting, and see if grades improve. Maybe toss in vitamin-C supplements with lunches? Wouldn't cost anywhere as much as some of the other possible solutions.

I found an article this morning when doing the study I promised titled "Democracy's Road to Tyranny" (https://fee.org/articles/democracys-road-to-tyranny/).  I've not heard of the site, the Foundation for Economic Education but it appears to be of a more conservative bent.  
I'm not sure that democracy and totalitarianism are the two ends of a continuum; I would think anarchy on the one side and absolute monarchy on the other; both can be tyrannical thought the former usually dissolves into a dictatorship as a strong-man emerges.  An absolute monarchy, like Saudi Arabia, cannot be classified as either a dictatorship nor a democracy and wouldn't fit on a continuum with those as the polar options.  To be honest, I'm not even sure that a continuum can accurately represent the variety of forms that a government can take.  I do think that the economic systems are classified correctly.  The third option, distributism, is not really a viable option and is only theoretical, as I understand it.

It's hard to think of Liberty as an "offshore" oil development.  There is a huge causeway that goes past it on the way to Endicott.  In the summer they even have Endicott Causeway fun runs that go past the pad where Liberty drilling will be staged.  The pad itself has high berms surrounding it to prevent spills from reaching the water.  So it's hard to think of Liberty as "offshore" when you can drive, run or walk to it.
